\begin{question}
Assuming that \verb|iter| is a \verb|vector<string>::iterator|,
indicate which, if any, of the following expressions are legal. Explain the
behavior of the legal expressions and why those that arenâ€™t legal are in error.
\begin{enumerate}[label=(\alph*)]
^^I\item \verb|*iter++;|
^^I\item \verb|(*iter)++;|
^^I\item \verb|*iter.empty()|
^^I\item \verb|iter->empty();|
^^I\item \verb|++*iter;|
^^I\item \verb|iter++->empty();|
\end{enumerate}
\end{question}
